meanings.definition: A type of antelope found in Africa.
meanings.sent1: The pukus grazed peacefully in the grassy savannah.
meanings.sent2: I saw a herd of pukus running across the plains.
meanings.sent3: The pukus decided to have a race to see who was the fastest antelope.
meanings.sent4: Her grace and agility on the dance floor reminded me of a pukus in the wild.
meanings.sent5: The pukus's distinctive white markings make it easy to spot in the herd.

meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, he felt sick and had to pukus behind the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The smell of the spoiled milk made her pukus immediately.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride made him feel like he was going to pukus his lunch.
meanings.sent4: The shocking news was enough to make her pukus out her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The terrible taste of the medicine made him pukus involuntarily.
